platformIndependence.pltIndependenceDesc:
Reveal uses the following proprietary dependencies, Mapbox and Firebase: 
 1. The Reveal platform requires Mapbox functionality to allow users to visualize their location on a digital map, and use the navigational aids within MapBox to move from house to house or village to village. We explored the use of MapLibre GL and OSM as open source alternatives to MapBox but found ease of use, the available documentation and configurablity were standout functionalities of Mapbox. 
 2. The Reveal platform uses Firebase Crashlytics to provide Reveal Android client crash reports. The insights generated by these reports provide context and detail that helps shape the direction of the Reveal roadmap. Firebase is simple to use and well documented. In addition to the available documentation, FIrebase is easily configurable to suit multiple use cases. Reveal is not dependent on Firebase for its core functionality and if removed from the solution, this will not impact the overall solution.

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies:
- The Reveal platform security strategy is underpinned by a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) methodology. Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) is a global standard security framework built on a role-based permissions management model that manages access at both the broad and granular levels by aligning the assigned permissions role with the organizational role of the user. RBAC prevents access leaks and, thereby, reduces the risk of data and information security breaches. 
- Access to production data is password protected and user rights and permissions are defined during system configuration. Access to monitoring services that ingest service logs is restricted to technical support staff and is protected by Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) authentication. PKI governs the issuance of digital certificates to protect sensitive data, provide unique digital identities for users, devices, and applications, and secure end-to-end communications. 
- Reveals’ infrastructure ís protected and encapsulated within a demilitarized zone (DMZ). Access to these components is governed via a Virtual Private Network (VPN), implementing the OpenVPN protocol. OpenVPN is an open-source VPN that is commonly used for creating Point-to-Point and Site-to-Site connections. It uses a traditional security protocol based on the  Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. 
 - Data transmission between Reveal Android client and Reveal Server is protected by the TLS encryption protocol. The Transport Layer Security  (TLS) generates an encrypted connection where the Android client acts as the client and user access is prohibited to specific applications instead of the entire network. 
 - Data at rest on the Reveal Android client is encrypted using the AES256-SIV-CMAC encryption standard. 
 Reference: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1noQM0B5cGr2tq344zPrB-Yz-c5j0DyPDEGzIzhQ9VRA/edit
